sanskrit_verse:
प्रेतशुद्धिं प्रवक्ष्यामि द्रव्यशुद्धिं तथैव च ।
चतुर्णामपि वर्णानां यथावदनुपूर्वशः ॥ ५.५७॥
transliteration:
pretashuddhiṃ pravakṣyāmi dravyashuddhiṃ tathaiva ca |
caturṇāmapi varṇānāṃ yathāvadanupūrvaśaḥ || 5.57||
sph_interpretive_translation: I shall now declare the purification of the deceased and the purification of property, in proper sequence for all four varnas.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from ontological clarity regarding life-transitional states
Causation follows sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) across embodied roles
Capacity-based responsibility aligns with varna-specific dharma-vyavastha
Restoration logic operates through ritual and material consecration
Consciousness alignment requires purification protocols rooted in Vedic order
executable_legal_axioms: IF a person transitions from embodied state THEN initiate pretashuddhi protocol based on varna-specific rites
IF property is inherited or transferred post-mortem THEN execute dravyashuddhi procedure according to Varna-dharmika injunctions
ALL purification sequences MUST follow anupūrvaśaḥ without omission or inversion
NO transaction involving purified entities SHALL proceed without prior completion of corresponding shuddhi process
VARNA-specific execution agents MUST be assigned based on capacity alignment within Vaidika parampara
supreme_court_application: In matters concerning inheritance, estate transfer, or legacy disputes, the Supreme Court must ensure that pretashuddhi and dravyashuddhi procedures have been executed per Varna-dharmika guidelines before recognizing legal validity. Responsibility lies with designated dharmika authorities whose threshold of jurisdiction is defined by scriptural succession and consciousness calibration.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that impurity arising from death necessitates sequential purification as part of natural law, not punitive correction. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures proportional alignment between embodied identity and required restoration. No suffering accrues; only procedural integrity maintains cosmic and social harmony.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Pretashuddhi Completion Process under certified Agnihotri supervision
Execute Dravyashuddhi via consecrated fire rituals aligned with Vastu-Shastra
Assign Varna-specific caretakers to assume transitional responsibilities
Reintegrate purified assets into societal circulation upon certification
Restore familial and communal dharmika balance through collective śrāddha observance
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. This Dharma stands restored. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the Supreme Adjudicator.
